top_categories.workout_context: 7,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
75ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Mammoth Tuff's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Mammoth Tuff, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Mammoth Tuff's High Sierra alpine gravel, Smooth fast roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Mammoth Tuff. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
7,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on high Sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Mammoth Tuff, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 7,500ft of climbing on high Sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Mammoth Tuff’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Mammoth Tuff with 7,500ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. Altitude 7,880-8,000 ft (30% less oxygen); High altitude sun intensity.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Mammoth Tuff requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast to build confidence. Expect: high sierra alpine gravel, smooth fast roads, june lake loop scenery.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of high sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast in Mammoth Lakes, California.
